body:
Basically, when you kill a player, you get a message saying something like:

ImRaging was slain by Legoche using iron sword (+2 Credits)

So, what if me and Budah both hit Raging to get the kill?

This should happen:

ImRaging was slain by Legoche and JustBudah (+1 Credits)


One credit for each player. Just a suggestion, it would help against kill stealing. Feedback?
body_tagged:

One credit for each player. Just a suggestion, it would help against kill stealing. Feedback?
title: (Suggestion) Kill Assists

replies.body: I think this would be good, but only to prevent kill stealing.
replies.body_tagged: I think this would be good, but only to prevent kill stealing.

replies.body:
I like the idea, but not always helpful. Sometimes I shoot people of a bridge, and then someone else hits them while falling. His shot didn't really help in killing much, so i reckon he then shouldn't get credits either.








































Those are nice shots then though ;)

replies.body: I think the person who hits the enemy first should get 2 credits, while the person that kills him (if he's another person) gets 1 credit for assisting.
replies.body_tagged: I think the person who hits the enemy first should get 2 credits, while the person that kills him (if he's another person) gets 1 credit for assisting.

replies.body: It would be hard to track who is doing the most damage to someone. Personally, while kill steals are annoying, they will just be part of the game.

replies.body:
This exists in call of duty block ops 2, but the amount of damage you deal is equal to the amount of reward.

For instance: 

ItzSevo was slain by Legoche (2 credits)

The assist guy gets a notification in the chat saying example

[Legoche got 1.75 credits and ou got 0.25 for killing ItzSevo because you dealt 2.5 hearts]

See what I mean m8s?

replies.body:
+1

But I think it should depend on how much damage you did. For example, if "Player" was fighting a diamond guy and Player did 95% percent of the damage, and "Randy" comes along and finishes him off, the credit's should not be split in half.
"Player" would get 95% of the credits
"Randy" would get only 5%

replies.body:
Actually with our current database this is impossible and would lag a lot. We already track every death and every kill, so imagine tracking every hit.

I kind of like the idea, but it's absolutely not doable at the moment.
